job.title: Site Reliability Engineer/SRE
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Consumer Electronics,Consumer Services
job.description: <ul><li>6+ years in a software development, DevOps role, or SRE role.</li><li>Experience in designing, investigating, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale enterprise systems.</li><li>Methodical and systematic problem solving approach, combined with a solid awareness of ownership, initiative and drive.</li><li>Fluency with running services at scale; In depth understanding of Unix systems internals and networking.</li><li>Networking knowledge and in depth understanding of network concepts, such as different protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc.), MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing).</li><li>Understanding of Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols along the way. Experience administering Linux systems in a production environment</li><li>Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: Go, Java, Python, Ruby, Shell</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or relevant work experience</li><li>Experience with distributed version control like Git or similar</li><li>Experience with IaaS and PaaS providers such as AWS, AZURE, OpenStack, GCP</li><li>Experience with containerization and container platforms. (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Docker EE, OpenShift, Mesosphere).</li><li>Experience with enterprise monitoring solutions like Dynatrace, AppDynamics, New Relic, Prometheus, Graphite, Grafana, Nagios, Sensu and Splunk</li><li>Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment processes and tools such as Jenkins, Maven, Nexus, etc.,</li></ul>
